intro: Pavetta dschaensis, commonly known as the Dschang pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has simple, opposite leaves that are usually oval or elliptical in shape. Pavetta dschaensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories or along stream banks.
